alert.note: Alert for Bradford; Coastal St. Johns; Eastern Alachua; Eastern Clay; Eastern Putnam; Inland St. Johns; Western Clay; Western Putnam (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 28 at 7:02PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Bradford, east central Alachua, St. Johns, Putnam and Clay Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 702 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Green Cove Springs to near Starke. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph, pea size hail, and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Saint Augustine, Palatka, Green Cove Springs, Starke, Interlachen, Keystone Heights, Hastings, Melrose, East Palatka and Middleburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Bradford; Coastal St. Johns; Eastern Alachua; Eastern Clay; Eastern Putnam; Inland St. Johns; Western Clay; Western Putnam
